job description:
CooperVision, a unit of The Cooper Companies, Inc. (NYSE:COO), is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of soft contact lenses and related products and services. The Company produces a full array of monthly, two-week and 1-day lenses, all featuring advanced materials and optics. CooperVision has a strong heritage of solving the toughest vision challenges such as astigmatism and presbyopia; and offers the most complete collection of spherical, toric and multifocal products available. Through a combination of innovative products and focused practitioner support, the company brings a refreshing perspective to the marketplace, creating real advantages for customers and wearers. For more information, visit www.coopervision.com.
JOB TITLE: Associate Scientist
DEPARTMENT: R&D Chemistry
JOB SUMMARY
Perform research and development in collaboration with others to support contact lens and ophthalmic materials development projects. Design, fabricate and test materials for contact lens products.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
  • Assist Scientists in designing and performing lab experiments, formulations and testing.
  • Work independently when operating lab machinery and equipment while following Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
  • Plan, schedule, and implement work assignments.
  • Make detailed observations, accurately record data in lab notebooks and interpret data and results.
  • Prepare technical reports, summaries and protocols.
  • Assist with investigating, creating and developing new methods and technologies for project advancement.
  • Interact with suppliers for chemical sourcing and releasing following relevant SOPs.
  • Work closely with cross functional teams.
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS
  • KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

    Ability to work in a team environment and follow company safety procedures.
  • Excellent communication skills, effectively and clearly communicate verbally and in writing.
  • Hands-on chemistry lab bench work experience required.
  • Ability to ensure GMP compliance when required.
  • Experience in organic or polymer chemistry is required.
  • Experience in supplier qualification, chemical raw material sourcing and releasing under GMP is a plus.

WORK ENVIRONMENT
Work in both chemistry laboratory environment and cubicle setting.


EDUCATION

Master of Science in chemistry or related field.

EXPERIENCE

5 years industry experience depending on level of education
